trigger_event: After BCI score equalization upends the city and Directorate crackdowns fail to restore order, the Council erupts in crisis. Pressure mounts for Sven to either retake control over the public narrative or risk everything on new, unpredictable alliances.
dilemma: Sven Halek must decide whether to stage a sham public tribunal—restoring the illusion of openness while quietly controlling which voices are heard—or risk everything by secretly enabling the Vanished citizens, letting their independent society operate outside Council control.
reason: With trust collapsing, Sven’s instincts and obligations as the Council’s chief communicator clash: manipulating appearances risks explosive exposure, while empowering the Vanished threatens to unravel the system he’s sworn to defend. He doubts which will buy more time—or doom the city faster.
choice_a: Authorize and stage a controlled tribunal, rigging citizen access and participation to preserve the system’s image and regain a semblance of order.
belief_a: Order is paramount, even if appearances must be managed.
Unfiltered voices could unleash chaos that cannot be contained.
Survival of the system requires shaping public perception, not raw truth.
choice_b: Secretly supply the Vanished with what they need to build their own independent networks, sabotaging BCI oversight and empowering an alternative society outside Council reach.
belief_b: True renewal can only come from breaking the old system’s grip.
Those already erased by the Council deserve real power and voice.
With the city on the brink, radical risks are sometimes the only hope.
